cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles NNE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, forecast to cross the Yucatan Peninsula then turn northward into the central/south-central Gulf of Mexico, aiming at the northern Gulf Coast (LA–TX) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana Gulf Coast (near or just east of the LA/TX border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Honduras/Nicaragua border to Punta Castilla, Bay Islands of Honduras, Puerto Cabezas northward, and Punta Herrero to Cancun (Tropical-Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Texas through Mississippi, including southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤11%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds at New Orleans; gusty winds possible if storm moves closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests minor to moderate coastal flooding; surge could exceed 3 ft along southeast Louisiana if the system intensifies and tracks west of the mouth of the Mississippi.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring several inches of rain; localized totals above 4 inches are possible if the center approaches Louisiana.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and higher waves over approaches to the Mississippi River channel may begin as early as Monday night, potentially disrupting pilotage and lightering operations.
